channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+1828] Lazy Or Awesome?: A Personality Test [Image]
item.description: Some might consider this enabling, I consider it an affirmation.

item.title: [+1758] Consumerist Writer: I don't have a reply, so I win. Bye.
item.description: An email thread about whether games and/or software can be returned in brick & mortar stores. Refers to: http://consumerist.com/2010/06/dont-buy-a-digital-game-and-expect-to-return-it-for-a-refund.html

item.title: [+1593] Why Penn and Teller won't cover Islam or Scientology ?
item.description: In this excerpt from a Las Vegas Weekly interview, Penn Jillette explains why he won't cover Islam or Scientology on his TV show, Bullshit!

item.title: [+1444] An Unexpected Visitor [pic]
item.description: At the peak on the Olympic mountains in Washington, an unexpected visitor arrives.

item.title: [+1417] iPhone Testing (PIC)
[+1346] How Superheroes Fly (PIC)
item.description: Superheroes take to the skies in different ways.

item.title: [+1214] You don't talk much Gordon
[+1168] Larissa Riquelme Will Run Naked If Paraguay Wins World Cup
item.description: Paraguay's success at the World Cup continued on Tuesday, with the country's soccer team beating Japan on penalty kicks to advance to the tournament's quarterfinals. Now, with only eight teams remaining, the Paraguayans may have a few more fans to help win it all.

item.title: [+1110] Han Solo and Chewbacca, 30 years later (pic)
item.description: There are some cool little details in this photo if you look close...

item.title: [+905] Republicans Say The Darndest Things: Video Compiles Dumbest
item.description: Clocking in at 10 minutes, this is the definitive dumb Republican quotes compilation. Featuring classics such as Joe Barton's "Apology," Andre Bauer's "Poor Children Are Stray Animals," and of course, Glenn Beck's "Obama Is A Racist," no collection is complete without these greatest hits.

item.title: [+777] The Funniest Sex Education Posters Of All Time (PICTURES)
item.description: Sex-education is a touchy subject (no pun intended). For religious, personal, or political reasons, not everyone can agree on the best way to educated the youth.

item.title: [+711] Kucinich: 'We are losing our nation to lies'
item.description: In Afghanistan, corruption is rife. It is so abundant, in fact, that a senior US lawmaker declared on Monday that she'd be freezing $3.9 billion in Afghan aid dollars until the situation is addressed.

item.title: [+698] First Direct Photo of Alien Planet Finally Confirmed
item.description: A planet outside of our solar system, said to be the first ever directly photographed by telescopes on Earth, has been officially confirmed to be orbiting a sun-like star, according to follow-up observations.

item.title: [+692] The 7 Most WTF Origins of Iconic Pop Culture Franchises
item.description: Every one of us has, at some point, watched a weird-ass movie or simply looked back over an insanely original idea and said, "How the hell did they even come up with that?"

item.title: [+641] HY WHY WHY ARE YOU CLOSED? TELL US THE REASON! [video]
item.description: Maybe he can't﻿ hear their reasons for being closed due to his head being lodged so far up his own ass.

item.title: [+538] Google Rolls Out Android 2.2 for All Nexus Ones
item.description: The Android 2.2 rollout has finally begun, starting with Google’s flagship phone, the Nexus One.

item.title: [+536] Apple Leak: Internal iPhone 4 Antenna Troubleshooting Guide
item.description: The antenna issues plaguing the iPhone 4 have infuriated many iPhone users (and rightfully so), but have you ever wondered how Apple is training its employees to deal with the fiasco? Well thanks to one of our Apple connects, we now know the exact procedures AppleCare reps must follow when dealing with any reception complaints regarding the iPhone

item.title: [+534] How cognitive surplus will change the world
item.description: Clay Shirky looks at "cognitive surplus" -- the shared, online work we do with our spare brain cycles. While we're busy editing Wikipedia, posting to Ushahidi (and yes, making LOLcats), we're building a better, more cooperative world.

item.title: [+528] 10 Most Stupid Predictions and Statements in History
item.description: We present a list of ten wrong predictions and statements that once said by famous engineers, doctors, producers ...

item.title: [+522] Street Legal TRON Lightcycles selling on eBay
item.description: That would be one bad ass motorcycle to see at night.
